articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The governor of Washington state on Friday said he was activating some members of the National Guard to be on stand-by after information and concerns regarding potential violence related to the 2024 election.
articles.title: Washington state activates National Guard in case of election violence

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Laila Bassam
articles.description: Israel bombarded the Gaza Strip and Beirut's southern suburbs on Friday, a day after U.S. envoys made a renewed but so far fruitless diplomatic push to end more than a year of fighting between Israel and Iran-backed groups Hamas and Hezbollah.
articles.title: Israel pounds Lebanon, Gaza after U.S. truce push

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Gram Slattery
articles.description: Democrats are readying a rapid-fire response to flood social media and the airwaves with calls for calm and patience with vote-counting should Donald Trump try to prematurely claim election victory, as he did in 2020, Harris campaign and party officials told Reuters.
articles.title: Democrats have a plan if Trump prematurely declares election victory

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: A U.S. judge on Friday denied Elon Musk's bid to move a Pennsylvania lawsuit over his $1 million voter prizes to federal court, moving the case back to state court.
articles.title: Elon Musk loses bid to move case over $1 million voter prizes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy called on Ukraine's allies to stop "watching" and take action to tackle the presence of North Korean troops in Russia before they start confronting his country in combat.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy urges allies to stop watching, start acting on North Korea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Countries at the U.N. COP16 summit on nature in Cali, Colombia, on Friday approved a measure to create a permanent body for Indigenous peoples to consult on United Nations decisions on nature conservation.
articles.title: UN COP16 nature summit creates permanent body for Indigenous peoples

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim, Josh Smith
articles.description: North Korea flexed its military muscle with the test of a huge new solid-fuel intercontinental ballistic missile dubbed Hwasong-19, state media said on Friday, amid international uproar over its troops deployed to aid Russia in Ukraine.
articles.title: North Korea says record test was new Hwasong-19 intercontinental ballistic missile

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: Firecrackers are central to Diwali celebrations for millions of Indian Hindus and this year was no different even as some cities banned their use to curb some of the worst pollution levels in the world.
articles.title: Despite bans, firecrackers sizzle across India for Diwali

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States said on Friday it will deploy B-52 bombers, fighter jets, refueling aircraft and Navy destroyers to the Middle East, in a readjustment of military assets as the Abraham Lincoln carrier strike group prepares to leave the region.
articles.title: US to deploy B-52s, warships to Middle East as aircraft carrier departs

articles.author: Alexandra Alper, David Shepardson
articles.description: The Biden administration on Friday finalized a new rule expanding its authority to review foreign purchases of real estate near U.S. military bases for national security threats.
articles.title: U.S. finalizes rule to review more foreign land deals near military bases
